    • Constructor Detail

      • KORGenerator

        public KORGenerator​(Mode mode)
        Instantiates a KORGenerator. The definied mode heavily influences how the KORGenerator generates the SQL Statements.
        DEFAULT the default mode of the KORGenerator. This should be equal to the users working expectation
        IGNORE the result of INSERT Statements is ignored thus no exception will be thrown
        Parameters:
        mode - the mode of this KORGenerator

    • Method Detail

      • generateInsert

        public java.lang.String generateInsert​(java.lang.Object object)
        Generates the INSERT-Statement of the given object
        Parameters:
        object - on which the INSERT-Statement should be generated
        Returns:
        SQL INSERT-Statement

      • generateTransactionInsert

        public java.lang.String generateTransactionInsert​(java.lang.Object... objects)
        Generates all INSERT-Statements wrapped in a single transaction thus increasing greatly the performance
        Parameters:
        objects - on which the INSERT-Statements should be generated
        Returns:
        SQL-INSERT-Statements wrapped in a single transaction

        public java.lang.String generateUpdate​(java.lang.Object object)

        Parameters:
        object - on which the UPDATE-Statement should be generated
        Returns:
        SQL UPDATE-Statement
        Throws:
        KORException - when a primary key is null

      • generateDelete

        public java.lang.String generateDelete​(java.lang.Object object)
                                throws KORException
        Generates the DELETE-Statement of the given object. The WHERE condition is depended on the information if it is a primary key by the column annotation
        Parameters:
        object - on which the DELETE-Statement should be generated
        Returns:
        SQL DELETE-Statement
        Throws:
        KORException - when a primary key is null

        Returns:
